intro: Kefersteinia lindneri, commonly known as the Lindner's kefersteinia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
